messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] conferences
messages.msgSnippet: ... We haven t completely decided yet. I am really homesick and I want to go home. DH wants to stay another two years. I am also aware that on a UK salary we
messages.messageBody:
Kelli Traaseth wrote:

> I'll pick ya up!
>
> But wait a minute! Moving to England? What happened to Minnesota, I'm soo crushed!
>
> Kelli
>

We haven't completely decided yet. I am really homesick and I want to go home. DH wants to stay another two years.
I am also aware that on a UK salary we would never be able to afford to visit the US again so common sense says we should stay another coupla years and see as much as we can. But common sense has
nothing to do with homesickness.
So I don't know.
DH is applying for jobs here in the US and back home in the UK. Then we'll roll a dice.
Maybe if I lived in a community with lots of unschoolers and no traffic instead of uptight North Virginia I'd be happier. Every time I find an unschooler here, after a bit I find them making their child
do curriculum cos they got anxious and while people make their own decisions it becomes difficult to explain to my kids why so-and-so wont play cos their mother considers 'school' more important than
playing.
Sigh.

Shyrley

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] conferences
messages.msgSnippet: ... I ve just got David Albert s book but I must admit that it made me feel slightly inadequate :-( We have musical instruments and the kids would like the
messages.messageBody:
Kelli Traaseth wrote:

> I suppose I will have to pick one or the other, <g>
>
> I liked David Albert's book, it was actually the first book I read that got me thinking about unschooling. That and Holt's, were my intros.
>
> Kelli, feeling like I am never going to get through all the e-mails!!
>

I've just got David Albert's book but I must admit that it made me feel slightly inadequate :-(
We have musical instruments and the kids would like the play them but we don't have the cash for lessons so they sit unused. I can play a recorder and thats about it.
While I admire him and love his writing I'd like to read a book where the kids don't get up till mid-day, play GTA for 6 hours straight and say 'huh?' when you ask them a question.
Shockingly enough mine havn't built a weather station, sjow no interest in tree types and areb't interested in fractals.
Are there home educators with kids like that?

Shyrley

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] conferences
messages.msgSnippet: ... You got any info on that? Shyrley
messages.messageBody:
Barb Eaton wrote:

> Kelly,
> Please, please keep in mind that Not Back To School Camp in W.Va. Is the
> end of Sept 25 til Oct 2nd. Ds wants to do both and see you all again. So do
> I. <G>
>
> Barb E

You got any info on that?

Shyrley

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] conferences
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think *wow* would be the wrong word....*gross out* would probably be better :-) Mind you, I m up to 30 miles on my bicycle so mebbe I ll be less flabby
messages.messageBody:
kbcdlovejo@... wrote:

> In a message dated 1/7/2003 9:59:26 PM Eastern Standard Time,
> marji@... writes:
>
> > Yeah, Shyrley! I seem to remember some talk about a "pyjama" party, an' I
> > got pyjamas just for the occasion!
> >
>
> And for you newbies, Shyrley was supposed to WOW us in her birthday suit!
>
> <G>
>

I think *wow* would be the wrong word....*gross out* would probably be better :-)
Mind you, I'm up to 30 miles on my bicycle so mebbe I'll be less flabby this year. But you still ain't seeing my birthday suit. Unless the lights are off.

Actually, its crossed my mind that I'm leaving the country soon after....I can be as outrageous as I want!

Shyrley

Plus I'll be a year older. 35 this year :-(

Shyrley

Columbia, South Carolina. Everybody COME!!

messages.subject: conferences
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/24/02 9:47:13 AM, abtleo@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/24/02 9:47:13 AM, abtleo@... writes:

<< where do I get into on these unschooling conferences, Sandra? You keep
mentioning them, and I keep seeing Christian and curriculum ones instead.
Web sites, or direct info, please. I'm away from home for 3 months and
haven't seen my HEM for ages...boohoo....probably what I need is in one of
those! >>

Here are the two I know most about, because I'll be there:

http://conference.hsc.org/default.html
Sacramento, California, August 16-18

http://www.schoolsoutsupport.org/index.html
Columbia, South Carolina, October 11-13
